p: In South America, enzootic EEEV is widely distributed in most areas of tropical forests, in the Amazon Basin in Brazil, and in Northern Argentina [ 40]. In these regions, EEEV is principally an equine pathogen and equine cases can occur year-round. However, human EEEV infections were rarely detected even during major equine epizootics [ 41- 43]. In temperate regions of South America (e.g., Argentina), EEEV infections often occur during the summer [ 44].
